seo.title: Path of the Gods via Nocelle shuttle
seo.description: Catch the Montepertuso–Nocelle bus for an out-and-back hike on the Sentiero degli Dei, with timings, tips, and return options.

linkLabel: Path of the Gods: Short Hike from Nocelle
intro: Short on time or want to skip multiple transfers? Ride the Montepertuso–Nocelle bus from Hostel Brikette, hike the most panoramic section of the Path of the Gods out-and-back, then return the same way.
This option avoids the ferry and Amalfi connection, making it ideal for calmer days or travellers who prefer a lighter itinerary.

sections.title: Get ready at the hostel
body: Buy two bus tickets per person at Bar Internazionale: Positano → Nocelle and Nocelle → Positano. Staff can advise on the cheapest combination.
Check the latest Montepertuso/Nocelle timetable so you know the last return before sunset.
Pack water, snacks, and layers. The kiosk in Nocelle offers drinks in season, but there are no shops along the trail itself.

sections.title: Ride the bus up to Nocelle
body: Wait outside Bar Internazionale. Buses display “Montepertuso - Nocelle” on the front.
The ride climbs through Montepertuso before terminating at the small car park in Nocelle. Stay on until the bus turns around to head downhill again—that is your stop.
Validate your ticket when boarding and keep it handy for the return.

sections.title: Walk through Nocelle to the trail
body: From the car park, follow the pedestrian stairs down to the main walkway and turn left.
Walk about 175 metres, staying right at the key junction to avoid the staircase descending to Positano.
Continue straight until you reach the Sentiero degli Dei signs and the stone path heading out of town.

sections.title: Hike as far as you like
body: Head toward Colle Serra for the best viewpoints. The full round-trip to Bomerano is about 11.6 km, but you can turn around at any time.
Follow the red-and-white CAI markers, step carefully on exposed ledges, and pause for photos at panoramic balconies.
When you are ready, retrace your steps back to Nocelle.

sections.title: Return to Positano
body: Walk back through Nocelle the same way, turning right at the key junction to reach the bus stop.
Use your return ticket for the bus down to Bar Internazionale or Chiesa Nuova. If buses are full, you can walk the paved road (about 4 km) but allow 45–60 minutes.
Avoid the stairway shortcut unless you intentionally want a long, knee-testing descent that finishes on the opposite side of town.

sections.title: Sample schedule
body: 06:30 bus → 06:50 arrive Nocelle → 3-hour hike → 09:50 return bus → 10:10 arrive Positano (3h40 door to door).
08:30 departure → 08:50 arrive Nocelle → 3h20 hike → 11:50 return bus → 12:10 arrive Positano (4h total).
10:30 departure → 10:50 arrive Nocelle → 3-hour hike → 13:50 return bus → 14:10 arrive Positano (3h40 total).

essentials: Two SITA tickets per person (uphill and downhill) plus a spare.
Water, snacks, sunscreen, and a hat for the exposed ridge.
Comfortable shoes with grip and optional trekking poles for uneven steps.
typicalCosts: Nocelle shuttle tickets: €1.80–€2.40 per leg depending on carnet.
Granita or drinks from the Nocelle kiosk: €3–€5.
tips: Aim for early morning departures to enjoy cooler temperatures and quieter paths.
Bring a light jacket—the ridge can be breezy even when Positano feels hot.
Save a celebratory treat at the kiosk near the church for your return.
warnings: Ignore the sign pointing down the stairs to Positano unless you want a strenuous descent that ends far from the hostel.
Buses run less frequently in the afternoon—set an alarm for the last return you can comfortably make.
The trail is exposed; avoid hiking in the hottest part of the day during July and August.

steps.name: Buy bus tickets
steps.text: Purchase Nocelle tickets at Bar Internazionale before leaving the hostel.

steps.name: Ride to Nocelle
steps.text: Catch the Montepertuso–Nocelle bus and stay on until it turns around at the car park.

steps.name: Reach the trail
steps.text: Follow the pedestrian path through town, keeping right to find the Sentiero degli Dei signs.

steps.name: Hike out-and-back
steps.text: Walk toward Colle Serra, turning around whenever you are ready to return.

steps.name: Return to Positano
steps.text: Retrace your steps to the bus stop and ride back to Bar Internazionale or Chiesa Nuova.

faqs.q: How long should I hike before turning around?
a: Many hikers continue 45–60 minutes toward Colle Serra for the most famous viewpoints, then retrace their steps. Allow more time if you plan to reach Bomerano.
Yes, but it runs on a fixed timetable with longer gaps midday. Check the posted schedule at Bar Internazionale and plan a buffer in case the bus is full.

faqs.q: Can I walk down instead of taking the bus?
a: You can descend the paved road in about 45–60 minutes. Avoid the staircase unless you specifically want a workout and are comfortable with thousands of steps.
